page.title: 04The River Conon
page.content: The River Conon divides the villages of Maryburgh and Conon.Many anglers come from all around to fish here.The River is for fly fishing only,spinning is prohibited,and also a permit is required.The fishing season is from February until the end of September.The River Conon is a well Known salmon river,but sea trout and brown trout can also be caught.The River is of particular use in the Gala week for events such as the Raft Race.The flood banks are being made bigger incase there is a repeat of the flood that took place about ten years ago when most of the bridge was submerged.Before the new bridge was built in 1963 you had to pay a fee to cross the river.You paid at an old,odd shaped house called the toll house.It still stands but there is nothing left of the bridge.A popular place where pi
